A bit hard to hear each other - lots of volume in the restaurant, and our waiter, although friendly, wasn't incredibly attentive. He seemed very busy and there was an air of entitlement by the waitstaff across the board - the restaurant is very popular, which they realize. 

I'd definitely go back, but focus on what they do best- pasta. The salad and the pizza weren't standout and on their own wouldn't warrant a return trip. 

Finally, the pricing was fantastic - so often you overpay in SF, and this was really well priced. Pay attention to the decor while you're there too.

Didn't save any room for dessert - hard to pace yourself with that many carbs.
author: Mary K.

description: My boyfriend and I went on date night to a Mano. It was fantastic and really reasonably priced. You have to experience the food and the atmosphere.
author: Alex G.

description: I love this new Italian spot in Hayes Valley--great ambiance, reasonable prices, and a focus on really delicious pastas. I had the cauliflower to start, and it was surprisingly tasty; they prepare it with chili and lemon, which gives it a nice, bold flavor. For mains, we shared the campanelle and bucatini all' amatriciana, and both were superb. Anything with pancetta is good in my book!
author: Benjamin A.

description: Pastas were yummy but this place is definitely not worth the crazy wait. Only time I've gone here is when I put my name down for a table and had a happy hour to go to at a bar nearby. I'll be returning when the hype dies down and wait times become reasonable.
author: Maya C.

description: This is a great place to have a meal with friends! The food was very good and the drinks were tasty. The waitress told us to order two plates each because they were small, but we did just fine with one order each for four people to share. The Pizza was very nice. Desert was fantastic.
author: Daniel B.

description: Lively atmosphere that was packed and buzzing but not too crowded. It's a great spot for family style dining (sharing) with friends so you can get a taste of multiple dishes. Great service and kind of has a Manhattan vibe going with the scene and surrounding decor. Highly recommend it if you're in the neighborhood, it's a good area and you can take a stroll after dinner and be ok if you stay on the main street - there are a lot of cute stores, restaurants, and bars near by too.
author: J Y.

description: Went there for diner. We had the arancinis (delicious), tapenade and bread and pasta to share. Pasta were amazing. The service was perfect. Nice terrace.
author: Vincent J.

description:
Great portions of pasta. Easy to share with everyone at the table. 

Fun and friendly environment. Sitting outside was enjoyable and the staff is passionate about the food and menu!
author: Audrey G.

description:
Every time I've tried to go here since it opened, there has been a 1.5 hour to 2.5 hour wait. Even by SF standards, that's long. Long enough that it took me until yesterday to actually wait it out for a table. So initial hack: get to Hayes Valley early and before you grab a drink at one of the amazing bars in the area, put your name down for a table. It might not even be ready by the time you finish two drinks. 
The restaurant is great - very spacious, huge windows. I shared the fontina arancini ($11) as an antipasti with my friends -  fried rice balls stuffed cheese. My friends were obsessed with them. While they did have a great sauce, they were mainly just good because they were fried rice balls stuffed with cheese. 
I also got the bucatini ($14), which I saw a lot of reviews recommend. It looks pretty boring - essentially spaghetti with red sauce - but it was very delicious, perfectly cooked and had the most flavorful sauce at the table.
author: Rachel E.

description: The wait here can be bonkers (2+ hours), but it's well worth it. Stand outs were the focaccia with a spicy oil drizzle, chicken meatballs, and a seasonal white pizza with thinly sliced summer squash. Pasta was fantastic too. Put your name in and have a cocktail at Brass Tacks next door.
author: Kevin S.

description: We were visiting from LA and saw how popping the place was, decided to go in for dinner the next day and fell in love. They have such fresh foods and a very clean open kitchen for customers to see. We had the arancinis ( yumm) and a flank steak dish (#bomb.com). This place is a must if you are in SF!
author: Janet P.

description: I came here for dinner one night with friends. The ambience was nice but unfortunately the food was mediocre. I was definitely expecting more considering the positive reviews and how busy it was.
author: Claire M.

description: Really great experience! I know that the made by hand pastas are the feature here, but the salads and appetizers are amazing as well. Really nice selection of cocktails and the prices across the board are very reasonable. No reservations, so unless you get there early, you can expect to wait, but worth it.
author: Rich L.

description:
This place is pretty good. I give it an extra star because of the housemade noodles. We got the pesto pasta which was very light but you could smell the pesto. The clam pasta was good as well. Both pasta dishes allowed us to really appreciate the noodles, which were cooked perfectly. They were perfectly chewy. I even took the leftover pastas home and reheated them and the noodles were still chewy. The noodles were also not oversalted, which is very refreshing because most places are way too salty. The appetizers were not too big nor too small. The mission fig, proscuitto crostini is nothing to really write home about but a good basic starter. We were able to get the soft shell crab salad and that was delicious. The dressing went really well with the perfectly fried soft shell. The monterey squid was amazing though. It came on a bed on corn (I love corn). You could take a bite of the squid, pepper and corn and its like amazing in your mouth. They were not stingy with the squid or the corn. Definitely a bang for your buck.
We got there at 5 and there as a line but made it to first seating on a saturday evening. There wasn't much of a line when we left at 630 but I'm pretty sure people were waiting for tables by the bar.
Servers were nice and attentive as well!
author: Jessica H.

description: We did enjoy our visit here, we love the food specially the  bianca pizza. The waiter who attends to us was very nice and friendly.
author: Mega Team R.

description:
Service excellent..especially our guy Brian.
Food excellent.
Clean.
Reasonable prices.

Two negatives:
Noise level almost painful.
Seats NOT comfortable.
author: Jim T.

description: Amazing food and great vibes! Most importantly, the service is top notch. Definitely go here!! They just opened. Cab blend was really good and the rigatoni pork was to die. Pasta is made in house. Would trade in my dog for their pasta... jk, never my dog but maybe my first born. Nom!
author: Theresa S.

description: Wonderful food and service.  The host was sooooo sweet and gracious.  Domingo was excellent.  John at the bar a delight.
author: Hugh G.

description: I literally ate my whole dish! It was so Delicious! I'm only sad I don't live closer so I could check out the rest of the menu!
author: Chelsea W.

description: This locations is amazing! The pasta is made onsite and you can watch them make it. The drinks are on point. The service was impeccable. And the space is gorgeous. A guy with amazing hair, I think his name was Jacob, was so welcoming and hospitable. I think this place fits right in Hayes Valley! I can't wait for the amazing outdoor seating! Great job once again!
author: Brent T.

description: Early review: Great wine(all Italian) prices and friendly service. Not sure why they dont serve focaccia with dinner, but maybe we got here late (~9:30). Overall the pasta is very good - I'd say maybe 3-5 notches away from authentic. The vibe is nice, the covers are spread out to maximize turnover, and the food has a nice amount of attention paid to it. You can tell they worked on menu r&d for a while. I can easily see this place being packed with hipsters on a weekend, so make sure to try it early on a weekday before they get slammed. Buonissimo, a Mano!
author: Amy C.

description: Great meal from start to finish.  Salad with heirloom tomatoes, fried chicken with wilted kale and an appetizer of roasted cauliflower- all delicious!
author: Halley V.

description: Pretty good ... pasta was great & my salad was very tasty too. Next time I'll try the fish which wasn't offered tonight, the pizza looked inviting. Portions are right on the money, the place is an excellent value as well. Come early because this place fills up fast. I tried to coax my pal into eating more but I couldn't. There seemed to be lots of other dishes I wanted to try.
author: Henry K.

description: Eating here right now with my colleagues after work and the staff is so friendly! They gave us meat balls on the house because they felt they took to long on our pizza, but we didn't even notice! I love the spacious feel and the lighting is amazing. I ordered the wallbanger cocktail and it was delicious.  We ordered the roasted asparagus, focccai, and pizza. It was all good! We will definitely be back!
author: Lisa W.

description: Great food - amazing, fresh pasta and well thought out flavors. The restaurant atmosphere and ambiance was also modern and beautiful. Service was wonderful. Will definitely be going back soon and bringing friends! It helps to come early (before 6pm) on a weekday right after work to avoid waiting to eat.
author: Michelle H.

description: Not much of a wait on a weekday up until maybe 7/730. We arrived right around 7 and were seated almost immediately. We shared three pastas between the two of us and that was probably the right amount of food, though because we are piggies we still wanted a little more. I love fresh pasta and am not gonna mess around with making it at home so a place where I can get a decent sized plate of fresh fancy pasta for about $15 is good with me. Great cocktail menu as well.
author: Katherine W.

description: It's been a while since I had pasta this fresh and cooked to perfection, hard to find in the city actually. Sauces and seasoning melded so wonderfully into the pasta that i actually wanted to order another one to go after cleaning out the plates... portion is perfect in terms of quality Italian dining, not distorted American crap like umm let's say something like Maggianos or even worse.. olive *puke* garden. Would definitely visit repeatedly and hopefully don't have to wait as long. Oh yeah low price point for Hayes .
author: Catalina C.

description: 2 1/2hour wait at 8:30pm for two people with 3 tables inside unused and 1 table outside unused. But they don't take reservations. Hmm? Went to Caffe Delle Stelle just on corner down the block and had a fabulous meal, no waiting, excellent service and some of the most delicious Italian food and wine we've ever eaten. Your $200 loss A Mono.
author: L. V.

description: Disappointing. Overhyped. Friendly service but not quite on top of their game. I was served my food without having been given napkin or flatware. Nothing worse than staring at your hot piping food but no fork! The chicken agnolotti was fine nothing mind blowing. Dessert menu was unimpressive... all gelato and sorbet with the exception of panacotta but knowing they didn't have a pastry chef I got the Nutella sundae. Two scoops of mediocre gelato. I won't be back
author: Nicole M.

description: Nailed it with location, space, food.  The mushroom app is a must.  Bianca pizza with broccoli rabe had all the perfect ingredients.  Pastas were great (tagliatelle and duck).
author: around town e.

description:
The pasta here is truly amazing -- the noodles themselves are delicate with a wonderful texture and the sauces are rich and flavorful.  The angnolotti are particularly special.  The starters, such as the duck liver mousse, are very nicely done with crisp refreshing flavors.

The lack of reservations, the crowded setting, and the speed of the courses make this more of a place for a casual meal than for a special occasion.  But the prices are reasonable and the atmosphere lively.
author: Peter H.

description:
I really wanted to like a Mano, as Delarosa on Market has treated me well, see my review

Waited in line about 25 minutes before it opened no problem that's SF

Pros: ?

Cons: Where do I start.....

Placed our order at around 5:10pm and did not receive our main dish until around 5:55pm
After the 2 tables next to us who came in later and order after us were eating their dessert 
I asked our waiter why we were being ignored and the perception did not look good as others who came in later were getting their food and we just kept on waiting, his response he was spacing out the timing of our meal...???? Two glasses of small pour wine, cauliflower appetitizer, two small pieces of sourdough bread and two pasta dishes that's it
The people around us order after us with more food were eating away while we were wondering what was going on
The manger did bring over our main dishes but could have cared less when I voiced my frustration. Just walked away....
I do go out to dinner about at least 3 times a week, not good tonight 
Cauliflower was alright 
2 pieces of sourdough toeasted bread.... about the same as pulling two pieces of bread and putting in the toaster at home
I ordered the stuffed chicken/pork pasta small portion no taste
My wife's pasta seemed a little better
Check came to $69.00. Bummer was not worth it
author: Curtis A.

description: Solid modern take on classic Italian food, decent wines and awesome service. We sat outside in the middle of winter and were toasty af. Great spot for a relatively quick Italian dinner / would definitely be a good date spot, too.
author: Hugh O.

description: Hanging out with friends in the city. Everything is so amazing here and we love the food and drinks here. Definitely coming back. Wish they could open until later, but I guess everyone has a life and the employees gotta go home to see with their familes :p
author: Vincent L.

description: Awesome and unique pasta dishes. You can't go wrong! Duck pasta was great! Very friendly and smiley service!
author: Dimitra S.

description:
We arrived around 6pm on a Friday night and it was packed. We got lucky and swooped on seats at the bar where you can order from the main menu. The food was really good and I especially enjoyed the crispy pizza crust, Monterey squid appetizer, and bucatini. The dressing on the gem lettuce salad was a little too salty considering the dish also had sardines. 

The service was lacking. We ordered the pizza and bucatini at the same time. The pizza came out in a timely manner but guests next to us received their pasta first even though we ordered several minutes before they arrived. We inquired about the delay with the bartender and he said the kitchen was backed up. We shrugged it off and ordered another carafe of wine. We then saw the bartender pass along a newly printed ticket to the kitchen and our pasta FINALLY arrived 20 minutes later. 

Overall, good food and nice space. Maybe better service when its not so busy?  I'm more of an Emmy's gal so I may have been a little put off by the vibe and crowd too.
author: Elisa T.

description: Kai was an amazing server and our food was great! Awesome visit and I highly recommend for anyone visiting SF
author: Madison G.

description: A friend and I decided to try their Pizza this week.  We got there before the dinner rush (about 5:15) which was great, we were seated right away.  The line was long by the time we left.  We split 2 different pizzas, the summer squash, stracciatella, vidalia onion, lemon ($16) and the salsiccia, chili sausage, tomato, provolone picante, olives, red onion ($15).  Would definitely go back, the food was great.  In fact, our pizza looked so good, another customer decided to order one to-go after her pasta and salad dinner.  Glad we tried it!
author: Carolyn K.

description: This place is getting lots of hype and a friend told us to give it a try.... It's pretty good but didn't blow either of us away. We got the summer squash pizza. It was definitely the best thing we got (the lemon was a nice added twist) but with so many amazing choices in the city (like the pizza at Zero Zero!!)  I wouldn't go back for it. We also got the bucatini pasta which I give a solid "C" grade. Regular sauce, nothing special. Overall the meal wasn't  very memorable. The drinks were great. Service was just ok - had to flag the waiter several times for more water, red pepper flakes, salt, the check, etc.
author: Gabrielle A.

description: Campanelle with celery root crema was a nice mix of flavors, with fresh ingredients. . could have used a little more sauce.
author: Katie H.

description: Great food overall, although the squid ink spaghettini was so spicy it was barely edible. Good cocktails. Mediocre service. Lackluster atmosphere... felt like I accidentally ended up in the Marina.
author: Michael S.

description: Really glad I finally got to try this place! wandered in unplanned on a Friday early evening and got lucky enough to sneak in at the bar behind a couple who was just finishing up. The wait definitely would have been long otherwise, this spot is super popular. Between two of us we split a bottle of wine, an app, a pasta dish and a pizza and only spent around $30 each, which seems very reasonable by SF standards. Had the cauliflower, Margherita pizza and the pasta with mushrooms and kale and everything was awesome. Will be back
author: Shelby S.

description: Michael's service along with an amazing pizza, the crust is light and airy with just the right amount of crispness and wonderfully fresh toppings, and pasta are so worth your time.  My friend asked Michael if he owned the restaurant, his service was so warm and caring.  And our leftover pizza was boxed and Michael brought it when we asked for the bill - now That is service.  The food was delicious we'll be back.
author: rena b.

description: My wife had a pasta Bolognese and I had the leg of duck dish after sharing a (large) arugula salad. The quality of ingredients and flavors were superb, and we left quite full. The restaurant is bustling but still maintains intimacy. The waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. We had to wait for a table but were given some leniency in responding to the text that our table was ready. A great experience!
author: Ken R.

description:
Had the privilege of attending an early preview and then again when it officially opened.  Service was warm and the food was tasty!  Food wise - Duck liver mousse is my go-to, the porchetta was delicious, as was the tripe pasta and the bronzini.  The drinks, the Rossini, Wallbanger and the Sirena were winners.  I would be skipping the agnolotti pasta next time as I found it to be a bit underwhelming.  When the restaurant officially opened, I put my name down and was told there was a 15-20 minute wait.  After 20+mins and with no text, I came back around and then was asked to be seated within 30 seconds.  I wonder if I would've been texted that my seat was ready if I hadn't been there physically to remind the host I was waiting?  Either way, I look forward to the heated patio seating (how will that be maneuvered?? haha) and trying the pizza the next time I'm in.

P.S.  I think building residents should get a free drink when dining here : )
author: Cameron W.

description: We finally managed to get a table here by trying late on a Tuesday evening.  We had read over-the-top reviews and had been really anxious to try this place, but the overall experience did not live up to the hype.  The best dish was my order, the Tuesday night special braised short rib, which was perfect and delicious, melt-in-your mouth.  My friend ordered the orecchiette pasta with clams and broccoli, and it was pretty much flavorless; the menu said it was supposed to come with chili flakes, but maybe the kitchen forget to add them?  For dessert we shared an excellent panna cotta with pieces of mandarin orange.  I ordered an Americano from the bar; it was spoiled by flat soda with no fizz and not enough ice, so that what ice there was melted too rapidly.  My friend's Rossini was better.  Service was just OK, the main problem being that our server seemed to be responsible for too many tables.  Once things were ordered, they came fairly quickly from the kitchen.  The real turn-off for us was the incredible loud noise level in this place - deafening - and management seems to like it that way.  When the place started clearing out and wasn't so noisy with people, they cranked the music up even louder to be sure we would have to continue to shout at each other across the table.  Why does every new restaurant want to be this way?  If we ever go back, we will hold out for one of the outdoor tables on the sidewalk - it will be much easier to talk over the traffic on Hayes Street than over the din inside the restaurant.
author: Stewart C.

description: Had heard lots about this restaurant including how difficult it is to get in, so gave it a try  for an early lunch. Got seated right away, but a bit of a wait for the server to come by. Ordered two pastas to share. Not happy. Both were over cooked and lacked sufficient salt. I think there are better Italian options in the city, even though this appears to be THE place to be---it was almost full by 12-12:30.
author: Hans G.

description: This cafe is simple, but I always come here because the food here is delicious, and especially the ice cream for dessert.
author: Daniel M.

description: There was a long wait to get a table, but it just opened so that was expected. Dishes are meant to be shared tapas style and every dish was fantastic! We shared the squid, had two pastas and a salad, including a surprisingly good drink menu. Will be back soon.
author: John G.

description: Atmosphere is nice. Good for drinks but the food is just average. Not impressed and won't go back.
author: Lilly J.

description: I have been there a couple of times and every dish has been great. I particularly enjoy the salcicia pizza, the pasta with the ragu sauce and the cauliflower. The drinks are also tasty. It can be quite crowded but the staff attempts to be helpful and Nicole in particular was really great on our visit. I can't wait to go back!
author: J. O.

description: My pasta craving stands satiated after dining at a Mano. Simple, delicious, homely, just the way i like my pasta to be. The radicchio salad deserves a mention as well.
author: Arpita B.

description: Been there for the first time. Fantastic vibe, delicious food, awesome cocktails and talented staff. Definitely coming back soon.
author: Frank S.

description: Had dinner at the bar last night, so good!! The service, cocktails and food all excellent! Candace was our bartender and was attentive to everyone at the bar. We shared several dishes and each one was excellent. Squid, cauliflower, tagliatelle, little gem, and a couple more, each better than the last. Go check it out!!
author: Kim S.

description: Amazing pasta, reasonable prices, cute sit. Expect to wait a long time to get a table but it's worth it.
author: Cassidy M.

description: This place is great! Been here many times and every time the pasta is great. Perfect for date night and just dinner with friends.
author: Lady R.

description: The food is good BUT they need to do something about taking reservations.   The first come first served thing only works if you have all night to waste for dinner.  I put 3 of us on the wait list last night around 8:00 - they estimated that the wait would be around 1 3/4 hours.  After 2, hours we gave up and went to Monsieur Benjamin.   The service is far better at Monsieur Benjamin. Also be prepared for a fairly brusk and rude hostess desk.  Their attitude is "We're busy!"   I tried again tonight.  They said it will around 45 minutes. We will see - already been an hour.  1 1/2 hours and they offered a communal table - off to Monsieur Benjamin now tonight too!   The seating process sucks here.
author: John T.

description: Was really excited to try this place. Came here at 6pm expecting at least a 45 minute wait on a Thursday night, but we were seated right away. Ambiance is adorable- perfect for date night. Right away I asked our server Luis for pasta recommendations and he gave us the most mouth watering descriptions I have ever heard. This man speaks pasta. Amazing food and service, can't wait to come back again!
author: Dennie B.

description: After a great meal, we left out the side door and my wife fell HARD on the raised pavement outside the side door.
author: Mark A.

description: Great service, food (interesting and unique pizzas, pastas, and antipasti), and heated seating outdoors.
author: Ro C.

description: Again the service the food and the atmosphere is really the best. Visit again and again order new or the same and it will knock your six off! This is a very welcome addition to Hayes Valley. I am sure already a A mano is drawing people to the Hayes.Great Great Zgreat!!
author: FRANK S.

description:
The food was delicious (5 stars) and the server was great (5 stars) (pleasant, attentive, and informative). The hostesses were challenging and inconsistently applied their policy of only seating complete parties. They insisted that everyone in our party (of two) be there before they would seat one of us. Before we sat down, we saw an incomplete party had been seated and was waiting for her +1. Apparently, it had been 10 minutes and the guest told the hostess their +1 was a minute away. Then, while we were eating dinner, we observed yet another person waiting at his table for his +1 to arrive. It was about 15 minutes before the other person showed up. If you're not going to take reservations (in a performance district when some guests are undoubtedly trying to dine and get to a performance on time) and tell some people they can't be seated until the party is complete, the policy needs to be applied consistently across the board. We'd love to go back again, but the attitude of the hostesses left us with a really bad taste. They also told us another policy was not to take reservations because they want to be a neighborhood place. 

At least one other restaurant in the area requires a credit card deposit, which is completely reasonable in a district where people are attempting to manage a business and the neighbors or performance-goers make or change plans at the last minute.  Without a reservation policy and an attitude adjustment by the host/eses, we're unlikely to go back.
author: Ellen B.

description: Great cauliflower, good pastas. Solid neighborhood spot, though I wouldn't wait in line to eat there.
author: Rohan S.

description: Good ambiance and decor, average service, price  point is good but portions are small. I probably wouldn't come again which is sad since I live the the neighborhood.
author: Ryan H.

description: great space, serves dinner until late, and great drink selection. but it's on the pricey side and the food is not exceptional (pasta was meh). a good place to grab a late night bite or drink, esp on Sunday.
author: Ruben K.

description: The best home made pasta I have had in a while. Good customer service, good wine, we sat outside and was perfect weather.
author: Vybs B.

description: I really liked a Mano! We had the fontina arancini, which were the right amount of gooey inside with no sign of greasy. The sauce it came with it had a hint of tart that paired well with the arancini. The mains we tried were the salsiccia pizza and the bucatini. The pizza was my favorite since the crust was just right - balance of crispy and chewy. I liked the pasta too, but the pizza was a favorite. Josh, the bartender was fantastic and we pretty much went with what he suggested for drinks. It was really fun watching him concoct some colorful, tasty creations and he's very personable, which was a nice change in SF's crowded,busy restaurant scene. I can't wait to go back and eat more pizza!
author: Sushma Y.

description: Hip and cool casual italian vibe but the food is mixed. Pastas were a little cold and not very original, pizza was better. Service is super friendly but not very attentive (we have waited 20+ minutes for our check on both occasions).
author: Chris S.

description: This place is a great addition to Hayes Valley.  Kudos to the owner for another successful and yummy place to eat.  Everything we had, cauliflower, pizza, steak and Fritto misto were delicious and of course fresh.  In spite of the crowd, the service was excellent, thanks to our server, Harry.  Most importantly, the price point is extremely reasonable considering its hip location.  It is worth the wait!  We are coming back.
author: Rowena L.

description: Had really great pasta here recently. The bucatini is excellent and was my favorite dish. The spaghettini was ok. The buttermilk panna cotta is also really outstanding. Nice waiters too. Will be back!
author: g b.

description: This is a great new sport to check out for sure!!  I came in last Wednesday with my boyfriend.  Ambiance is great.  The entire staff from the host to the waiters were awesome and welcoming.  Even though it was packed with a line, the experience was awesome.  They were all super friendly.  The host had quoted us 45mins wait but we only had to wait less than half hour and the host was very accommodating and got us great seats and options.  The service was awesome, not just from our server but from everyone.  The food was delicious too.  We highly recommend it and can't wait to go back!
author: Juliana P.

description: This place was very crowded on a Tuesday evening. We waited about an hour to get a table for two. The pastas and wine were very good, but very pricey. The portions and amount of food per pasta dinner were very small for $20 a plate. Good food and service, but definitely expensive for what your getting.
author: Tony C.

description: Great service, food, drinks, and ambience! This is my new favorite spot in Hayes when I'm craving some amazing pasta and drinks. Plus, they are open late!
author: Jen W.

description: This spot nailed it. Great vibe and every dish was delicious. Also, the prices!!!!! Stoked about this place and am looking forward to many returns. Keep up the good work :)
author: Mike J.

description: Good cocktails, good food (however don't get their clam pasta- not very flavorful compared to the other pastas we got), and good service.  Only giving 3 stars though because of the amount of food you get for the price. My boyfriend and I got the chicken meatballs, spilt 3 pasta dishes, and dessert and we still left hungry.
author: Alayna D.

description: The first time we went to this restaurant after a broadway show we really liked the food even though it was noisy and it was kinda hard to talk. So we decided to go again and the 2nd visit was not quite as good as our first. The server was inattentive, forgot to bring our ordered drinks and had to be reminded, didn't clean up any crumbs or spills on our table when we were ready for dessert, and only gave 2 dessert menus when there were 4 of us dining. We decided to pass up on dessert because of that. The margherita pizza was like eating cardboard (if I ever ate cardboard), thin unappetizing sauce, very little mozzarella cheese and basil was haphazardly strewn about. The Salciccia pizza we also ordered was better although a bit on the salty side. The home made pasta is not bad but nothing to rave about. Probably would go back again if there are no other options elsewhere but if they want to retain loyal customers they need to pay more attention to their service.
author: TJ W.
